intro: Helianthemum supramontanum, commonly known as the alpine sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are usually small, hairy, and arranged alternately along the stems. Helianthemum supramontanum is well adapted to harsh climatic conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
